name: Champion of the Gods
description: Will you serve the gods or overthrow them? Battle ancient evils and destiny itself in this epic interactive novel inspired by Greek myth.

reviews.review_text: Excellent writing and a deep understanding of Greek Mythos that comes across to make a very engaging CYOA. However as is the problem with all CYOA on this engine, the amount of stats and what they mean do not translate well into making decisions.   Worth it at 3$, get it on sale.

The story is fun, puts you into Greek mythology. My only complaint is that there are times when you feel like the game presents you with nothing more than the illusion of choice. Meaning the game appears to be offering you a genuine choice of several very different options yet whichever you choose the result will be the same with only lipservice paid to the actual choice you made. So...I'm unsure how many real 'change the plot' choices there are or if the plot is basically set in stone and you are just dictating the tone/dialogue/windowdressing.

I really enjoy a lot of the Choice of Games titles. I wasn't sure if this one would end up standing out or not from the demo, but it did. Then length is very good, so it's worth it's money at least in content. It doesn't tackle any particularly new ideas, but it's not trying to as much as set you in an ancient tale. This is fine, it does it well. You feel like you have quite a bit of agency, some of the twists are not easily predicted, I found no obvious bugs in mechanics or dialogue, the stats you built are meaningful and consistant, and the writing quality stays solid through to the end. It might not be a title I recomend to people who are new to text adventures or CoG brand in particular over some other riveting titles, but it is a really enjoyable game. The price is pretty reasonable for the content, but if you're not sure about it, picking it up during a sale is resonable. If you come to enjoy the genre, definitely check out their website for more of their games since they're not all on Steam. Every game has a free demo, and a handful are free all the way through.  TL;DR: Fun game if you're already a text/CoG fan, if not, pick it up on sale and give it a try anyway. I enjoyed it.

After Having put in countless hours in Pendragon Rising and Choice of Kung Fu prior, I can say that this is the best one of these 'Choice' series of games I've played yet! The adventure is epic, the decisions really feel like they matter, there are so many ways to succeed and fail and the feelz! Great story, great writing, takes a little bit from homer's odyssey and other greek-like myths butt still feels fresh, well planned and very well thought out. Tin Star will be the next one I purchase and play after this one.

so ill say this first so you know how i feel about this game I LOVED EVERY MINUTE the writing was so well put together that i was complety absorbed by it to the point that when i tried putting on music in the background I found its was just destracting me from the game and I turned it off and returned back to the world of the game if you are looking for a great choice your own adventure game look no further I already want to start a new game to see what I missed or what parts I can explore more because every descion felt important to me and the character I was creating, ive definetly enjoyed and been immersed more in this text only game than quite a few AAA games.  in short it has great story, vast replay value, and if you take the game in and enjoy the world the text and your mind create a playthrough will only take 7 hours so even at its normal price of $4.99 if you us the the $1/hour method for games this one is worth your time.
I felt like i did not have enough choices that would change the outcome majorly. The story was short but sweet, i would not recommend this game to friends because of the price.
Weak story, no more parts coming it looks like.
Truly a great tale woven by great Weavers(Slight spoiler), the tale was great and amazing I can only wish that others will tell the tale from their view.(Hinting that there are mutliple paths)

This was truly without lying one of the best games I have ever played. The story is very indepth and it was not that short at all. If you like text based story games or just want to try something new I strongly recommened this game!
Amazing game that combines several greek myths while allowing you to make choices. Including the choice to end your destiny

Great game. Took me about three hours to finish my first playthrough. Great story even if it's a bit predictable. Some nice twists and dilemma.   If you're a fan of greek mythology and others choice of games, you'll surely enjoy Champion of the Gods.
What a wonderful game. It has a great in depth story and i loved playing every minute of it. I wish there were more games like this out there.
Great story. The romance was kinda lackluster but I since that's not the focus of the story, I don't really mind it. Will be playing it again sometime soon.
You know it's good game when you accidentally ruin the world but still get married.
